0.title: I call myself 'spin-fast' bowler who prefers bowling at around 100 kmph: Rashid Khan
0.article_body: Gujarat Titans vice-captain Rashid Khan has said that he calls himself a 'spin-fast' bowler because of the pace at which he bowls. He added, "The speed at which I bowl is somewhere around 96-100 kmph. It's hard to generate turn at that pace, but I'd rather bowl at that speed than bring it down to 70-75 kmph."

1.title: Italy ends COVID-19 state of emergency after 2 years, lifts curbs
1.article_body: Italy on Friday ended a COVID-19 state of emergency initially announced two years ago and began lifting curbs. Attendance limits for sports venues and a requirement for people aged over 50 to show vaccination proof to enter their place of work have been lifted. Italy has reported over 14.6 million cases and 159,383 deaths since the pandemic began.

2.title: Dealing with pressure in last 5 overs of game: Hesson on RCB's new strategy
2.article_body: RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the side has come up with a new strategy that'll help players in dealing with pressure in last five overs of the match whether they are bowling or batting. "No matter what option...field you have, you have to have at least three options in terms of deliveries you can bowl," he stated.

3.title: COVID-19 deaths increased globally by 43% last week: WHO
3.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said between March 21 and 27, the number of deaths due to COVID-19 increased globally by 43%. The number of new COVID-19 cases decreased by 14% during the same period. WHO said over 10 million new cases and over 45,000 new deaths were reported last week across the six WHO regions.

4.title: Churches, historical sites, museums damaged by war in Ukraine: UN
4.article_body: UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) on Friday said many churches, historical sites and museums have been damaged by war in Ukraine. “We are very concerned about both the situation at the humanitarian, cultural heritage levels...” Ernesto Ottone, UNESCO’s Assistant Director-General for Culture said. The agency added that 29 religious sites were destroyed in the war.

5.title: My life is in danger: Pakistan PM Imran Khan ahead of no-confidence vote
5.article_body: Pakistan's PM Imran Khan told ARY News, "My life is at risk too, they (Opposition) have also planned for my character assassination. Not only myself but my wife too." Earlier, Pakistan Minister Fawad Chaudhry claimed that a plot to assassinate Khan was reported by the security agencies. This comes ahead of Sunday's no-confidence motion in the National Assembly against Khan.

6.title: BJP becomes first party to cross 100-seat mark in Rajya Sabha since 1990
6.article_body: The BJP has achieved 101 seats in the Rajya Sabha for the first time in its history and has become the first party since 1990 to do so. This came after the party won four of the 13 seats up for election in the 245-member Upper House in the latest round of polls that concluded on Thursday.

7.title: Russian forces are regrouping not withdrawing in Ukraine: NATO
7.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Thursday said Russian troops are regrouping and not withdrawing from Ukraine despite promises by Russia of a partial withdrawal of troops. "The Ukrainian forces are now bigger, better equipped, better trained and better led than ever before," he said. Stoltenberg warned Ukraine of "additional offensive actions, bringing even more suffering."

8.title: Soldiers who drink not Indians?: Tejashwi on CM's 'Mahapaapi' remark
8.article_body: Commenting on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's "people who drink alcohol aren't Indians but 'Mahapaapi'" remark, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Friday said that going by his logic, Indian soldiers who drink are also not Indians. Taking to Twitter, Yadav added, "Criminals who spill rivers of blood and the corrupt aren't 'mahapaapi' (sinners) or 'maha-ayogya' (good-for-nothing people) but drinkers are?"

9.title: Israeli forces shot dead Palestinian in occupied West Bank
9.article_body: Palestinian Health Ministry on Friday said Israeli forces shot dead a Palestinian resident during clashes between Palestinian residents and Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank city of Hebron. As per Israeli forces, they killed the man after he threw a firebomb at them. This comes after three Palestinians were killed on Thursday in two separate incidents.

10.title: BJP's Suvendu suspended from WB Assembly, likens move to Emergency
10.article_body: BJP MLA and Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari was on Thursday suspended from West Bengal Assembly for the remainder of the session that began on March 7. He said the decision reminds him of Emergency and called it a "dark chapter in the history of Indian politics". Adhikari was suspended days after BJP and TMC MLAs clashed over Birbhum violence.

11.title: FIFA reveal 'La'eeb' as World Cup 2022 mascot, share pic
11.article_body: FIFA have unveiled La'eeb as the official mascot for this year's World Cup, which will be held in Qatar. "La'eeb is an Arabic word meaning super-skilled player. He belongs to a parallel mascot-verse that is indescribable...everyone is invited to interpret what it looks like," FIFA said. "La'eeb encourages everyone to believe in themselves as 'Now is All'," it added.

12.title: 23-yr-old tourist, guide killed while paragliding in North Sikkim
12.article_body: A 23-year-old tourist from Telangana and her guide died while paragliding in North Sikkim's Lachung on Friday. Esha Reddy and her 26-year-old guide Sandeep Gurung took off from Lachung View Point, following which they lost balance due to the strong winds and fell into the Lachung river, police said, adding they were swept away by the strong currents.

13.title: Russian invasion killed over 150 children, hurt 245 so far: Ukraine
13.article_body: Office of the prosecutor general of Ukraine on Friday said 153 children were killed since Russian invasion began on February 24. The office added that 245 children were injured in Ukraine so far. Reportedly, at 73, the Kyiv region reported the most number of deaths followed by Donetsk and Kharkiv with 65 and 46 fatalities respectively.

14.title: Ensure patients get best facilities in all hospitals: UP CM Yogi
14.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday chaired a high-level meeting with officials and asked them to ensure that patients get the best facilities in all hospitals and medical colleges in the state. He directed them to conduct a detailed physical review of fire safety and electrical safety mechanisms at these places. "System should be updated to avoid...mishap," he added.

15.title: China will pursue peace in Ukraine in its own way: Chinese PM to EU
15.article_body: Chinese PM Li Keqiang on Friday told European Union (EU) leaders that China would push for peace in Ukraine in "its own way". During the virtual summit, the EU asked China not to allow Russia to circumvent Western sanctions imposed over the invasion of Ukraine. Notably, China has forged closer energy, trade and security ties with Russia in recent years.

16.title: Turkey's Erdogan calls for dialogue between Russia, Ukraine
16.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Friday called for dialogue between Russia and Ukraine, in a call with Russian President Vladimir Putin. In a statement, the Turkish presidency quoted Erdogan and said the "positive and constructive" talks had raised hopes for peace. This comes after the two leaders discussed peace talks between Russian and Ukrainian officials this week.

17.title: 2 UK teenagers charged over Lapsus$ hacks that hit Microsoft, Nvidia
17.article_body: The City of London Police have charged two teenagers, aged 16 and 17, with multiple cyber offences linked to an investigation into the Lapsus$ hacking group. The police did not reveal the identities of the teenagers because they are minors. The Lapsus$ hacking group, which first surfaced in December 2021, has targeted companies including Microsoft, Nvidia, Samsung, Ubisoft and Okta.

18.title: How does Farah's *ss taste? Urfi on Kashmera's 'Instagram famous' remark
18.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed has reacted to actress Kashmera Shah's remark calling her 'famous on Instagram and not anywhere else', saying, "You are not famous in either of them, what's the point?" Urfi further said, "How does Farah's *ss taste?" Earlier, designer Farah Khan Ali had stated that Urfi needs to be reprimanded for her distasteful dressing.

19.title: US raises $204 mn in humanitarian aid for Afghanistan
19.article_body: US on Thursday announced $204 million in humanitarian aid for people of Afghanistan. "This funding will provide emergency cash, shelter...and reintegration assistance to internally displaced...in Afghanistan and refugee populations in neighbouring countries," said US Agency for International Development (USAID). Afghanistan plunged into crisis since Taliban took over in August last year.

20.title: 'RRR' becomes 2nd-highest grossing movie in India, earns over ₹500cr in a week
20.article_body: SS Rajamouli directorial 'RRR' concluded its first week at the Indian box office with ₹560 crore earnings, making it the second-biggest grosser ever in the country. It surpasses the earnings of 'Dangal' (₹511 crore) and now stands next to 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' (over ₹1,000 crore). As per film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, 'RRR' has grossed ₹710 crore worldwide.

21.title: World no. 16 Alcaraz beats Kecmanovic to reach Miami Open semi-finals
21.article_body: World number 16 Carlos Alcaraz on Thursday beat Miomir Kecmanovic 6-7(5), 6-3, 7-6(5) to reach the semi-finals of the Miami Open. Alcaraz reached his second consecutive ATP Masters 1000 semi-finals after making it to the final four in Indian Wells last month. The 18-year-old will face defending champion Hubert Hurkacz in the semi-final.

22.title: Pune corporation takes steps to tackle rodents inside PMC office
22.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has taken steps to address the complaints of frequent incidents of spotting snakes and rats inside the office. "The building is close to the river so the snake managed to sneak in... Directions have been given to shift... on the top floor," said Executive Engineer Yuvraj Deshmukh. Notably, the PMC's health department is also informed.

23.title: Germany charges ex-military officer with spying for Russia
23.article_body: German prosecutors on Friday charged former military reserve officer with spying for a Russian intelligence service for years. As per the prosecutors, the indictment against the suspect was filed on March 16 at the state court in Dusseldorf. They added that the suspect was allegedly in contact with Russian intelligence "via various people" by October 2014.

24.title: Instagram rolls out 7 new messaging features including 'Silent messages'
24.article_body: Instagram is rolling out seven new messaging features - 'Reply while you browse', 'Quickly send to friends', 'See who’s online', 'Play, pause, and re-play', 'Send messages quietly', 'Lo-fi chat' and 'Create a poll with your squad'. Users will now be able to send messages without notifying friends late at night or when they're busy by adding "@silent" in their messages.

25.title: It's great to be back: Cummins on joining KKR camp in Mumbai for IPL
25.article_body: On joining KKR's squad in Mumbai for IPL 2022, Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said, "It's been over a year since...first half of last IPL. It's great to be back." Cummins had missed second leg of IPL 2021 in UAE due to paternity leave. Cummins led his side to a 1-0 win against Pakistan in recently concluded three-match Test series.

26.title: 8.5% drop in Bundesliga revenue, largely due to COVID-19: Report
26.article_body: A report by the German Football League (DFL) said that the revenue generated by the Bundesliga clubs in 2020-21 got reduced by over 8.5% to $3.84 billion. "Sadly, it (COVID-19) is also affecting the current season, primarily because once again the stands often had to remain empty," said Donata Hopfen, speaker of the DFL Executive Committee.

27.title: World no. 2 Swiatek wins 16th straight match to reach Miami Open final
27.article_body: World number two Iga Swiatek on Thursday beat Jessica Pegula 6-2, 7-5 to claim her 16th consecutive match-win and reach the final of the Miami Open. Swiatek's semi-final win also means she has reached her third straight WTA 1000 final. The 20-year-old, who will become the world number one on Monday, will face Japan's Naomi Osaka in the final.

28.title: Nick Kyrgios fined $35,000 for his behaviour at Miami Open
28.article_body: Tennis' governing body ATP on Thursday said Nick Kyrgios has been fined $35,000 for his behaviour during his fourth-round loss to Jannik Sinner at the Miami Open. Kyrgios was fined $20,000 for verbal abuse, $10,000 for unsportsmanlike conduct and $5,000 for audible obscenity. The ATP added that Kyrgios repeatedly criticised the umpire and smashed his racket during the match.

29.title: It’s no fun at all: Mercedes boss Wolff on team’s current struggles
29.article_body: Mercedes team boss Toto Wolff described his team's current struggles as "no fun at all." Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton finished 10th in the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix with teammate George Russell finishing fifth. "It's an exercise in humility and it's going to make us stronger in the end, even though it's not fun right now," Wolff said.

30.title: Israel and UAE complete negotiations for free trade agreement
30.article_body: Israel and the UAE have concluded negotiations for a free trade agreement (FTA), Israel's Economy Ministry announced on Friday. The agreement seeks to abolish customs duties on "95 percent of the products" exchanged between the two countries, it said. "This milestone deal will...cement one of the world's most important and promising emerging trading relationships," the UAE said.

31.title: Amazon's Andy Jassy gets $212 million compensation in his 1st year as CEO
31.article_body: Amazon's Andy Jassy, who took over as CEO in July 2021, received a compensation of about $212 million last year. While Jassy's base salary remained unchanged at $175,000, the vast majority of his compensation came in the form of a stock award of 61,000 shares. That award "is expected to represent most of Jassy's compensation for coming years", Amazon said.

32.title: Bowlers enjoy talking to him: Sangakkara on RR's fast-bowling coach Malinga
32.article_body: Talking about RR fast-bowling coach Lasith Malinga, Director of Cricket Operations and head coach Kumar Sangakkara said it's "exciting and huge" to have him. "Bowlers really enjoy talking to him, while he's there at the top of their marks. Discussing...debating fields and deliveries. He's been exceptional," he added. "He's just directing the players to keep things simple," Sangakkara further said.

33.title: Portugal’s Bruno Fernandes signs new long-term contract with Man Utd
33.article_body: Manchester United on Friday announced that Portuguese midfielder Bruno Fernandes has signed a new long-term contract with the club until June 2026 with an option to extend a further year. Fernandes, 27, has scored 49 goals and registered 39 assists in 117 appearances in all competitions for Manchester United. Fernandes joined the club from Sporting Lisbon in January 2020.

34.title: Ranbir is the cat, I'm the dog in our relationship: Alia Bhatt
34.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that her boyfriend actor Ranbir Kapoor is the cat and she is the dog in their relationship. Alia further said she sometimes wakes up with a lot of energy and Ranbir calms her down. "He is way calmer than I am...I rely a lot on him to pass on some of that calmness," she added.

35.title: Skill of B'wood actors is unsurpassed, don't have it in H'wood: Jake
35.article_body: Actor Jake Gyllenhaal in an interview has stated that the skill of Bollywood actors is unsurpassed. He added that being able to sing, dance and act at the same time is a real requirement which isn't there in Hollywood. "The films in Bollywood are so inspiring...I have so much admiration for the filmmaking and...acting coming out of India," Jake said.

36.title: Tried not to be too hard on myself after breakup with Camila: Shawn
36.article_body: Singer Shawn Mendes has spoken about his breakup with singer-actress Camila Cabello, saying that he gave himself a lot of grace and tried not to be too hard on himself about his feelings. "It was learning how to trust...again...Instead of...calling just one person, I [now had] six people I could call and like balancing out that," Shawn said.

37.title: Ram Nath Kovind becomes first Indian Prez to visit Turkmenistan
37.article_body: Ram Nath Kovind on Friday became the first Indian President to visit Turkmenistan, according to Rashtrapati Bhavan. "President Ram Nath Kovind was received by President Serdar Berdimuhamedov...and accorded a ceremonial guard of honour on his arrival at the Ashgabat airport," it tweeted. "The state visit of the President will reaffirm the importance we attach to Turkmenistan," an official said.

38.title: 6 wolves die in Indore zoo in 3 days after rabies outbreak
38.article_body: Six of the eight wolves at the Kamla Nehru Zoo in MP's Indore have died of rabies within three days. The wolves were kept in separate cages, the zoo in-charge Uttam Yadav said, adding that the remaining two wolves haven't shown rabies-like symptoms yet. "The cause of the outbreak is yet to be known," he further said.

39.title: It was like Niagara Falls in terms of wetness: Fleming on dew after CSK's loss
39.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming compared the dew during his team's IPL 2022 defeat against LSG to the Niagara Falls. Justifying their move to make all-rounder Shivam Dube bowl the 19th over, Fleming said, "Spinning options were taken out of play because it was like Niagara Falls in terms of the wetness." Dube conceded 25 runs in the 19th over.

40.title: I have enough, I've done enough: Jim Carrey announces retirement
40.article_body: Actor-comedian Jim Carrey has stated that he will retire from acting after 'Sonic the Hedgehog 2', saying, "I have enough. I've done enough. I am enough." He further said that he likes his quiet life and putting paint on canvas. "If the angels bring some...script...that...is going to be really important for people to see, I might continue," Jim added.

41.title: Woman attempts self-immolation outside BJP office in UP's Lucknow
41.article_body: A woman from UP's Gosainganj tried to set herself on fire outside BJP's Lucknow office on Friday. The woman said she took the step as her son had been forcibly sent to jail by the local police despite being innocent. Her self-immolation attempt was, however, stopped by the policemen on duty outside the office and the matter is being investigated.

42.title: Domestic PNG gets costlier by ₹5.85 in Delhi & Noida as IGL hikes prices
42.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited said on Friday that it's hiking the price of domestic PNG by ₹5.85 from April 1 to partially cover the hike in input gas cost. With this, per standard cubic metre (SCM) will cost ₹41.61, including VAT, in Delhi. It will cost ₹41.71/SCM in Gautam Buddha Nagar. Previously, the price was hiked on March 24.

43.title: Time not apt to discard COVID-related precautions: ICMR-NIV official
43.article_body: Priya Abraham, Director of ICMR-NIV, said on Friday that the time is not right to discard coronavirus-related precautions. Her comments came at a time when states like Maharashtra and Telangana made mask-wearing optional. "Right now COVID-19 infections are low, it's...good. In any crowded place, we must wear a mask...A mask definitely has a role in containing the spread," she explained.

44.title: Hindi film industry struggling to find good stories: Shahid Kapoor
44.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor in an interview has stated that he feels that the Hindi film industry is struggling to find good stories. "It is important to recognise the fact that today a real star...or someone who is widely connecting with people would be the kind of person who collaborates with the right kind of content creators," the actor added.

45.title: 8,278 Indian prisoners in foreign jails: Govt to Lok Sabha
45.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan has informed the Lok Sabha that 8,278 Indian prisoners, including undertrials, are lodged in foreign prisons at present. Of these, 156 are serving life sentences, he added. The government attaches the highest priority to the safety and well-being of Indians in foreign countries, including those in prisons, he further said.

46.title: Man shares pic of Tharoor as child actor, 'tried to keep it secret', says the MP
46.article_body: Film writer Vaibhav Vishal on Friday shared a still from a movie that Congress MP Shashi Tharoor acted in as a child, saying, "[Tharoor's] screen name was Master Gyaan and he did nine Hindi and Malayalam films." Reacting to the picture, Tharoor said, "And I had tried to keep it secret all along! Good sleuthing...I'm still known as Master Gyaan."

47.title: Future Retail misses due date to repay ₹5,322 crore to its lenders
47.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) on Friday said it has missed the due date for the repayment of ₹5,322.32 crore to various banks and lenders. The company also said that it failed to raise ₹3,900 crore before March 31, 2022, under the One Time Restructuring (OTR) scheme. FRL said it was unable to do so due to the ongoing litigations with Amazon.

48.title: Corporate India's mood is cautiously optimistic: Uday Kotak
48.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak said that corporate India's mood is "cautiously optimistic" now that the post-COVID-19 economy is showing signs of bouncing back. Speaking about inflation, Kotak told CNBC-TV18, "India is not so much out of line given our inflation. The path we...need to traverse is a smaller move compared to what the developed markets have to."

49.title: IIM Ahmedabad plans to change logo; 45 faculty members oppose the change
49.article_body: At least 45 faculty members have opposed a proposal to change IIM Ahmedabad logo, saying, "it'll have long-term consequences" on the institute's brand. Following criticism, IIM Ahmedabad said, "The proposed logo retains the status line in Sanskrit (Vidya Viniyogadvikasa) as in the original." It added, "The 'jaali'-inspired brand mark has been made more amenable to communication in digital media."

50.title: Evergreen's 'Ever Forward' ship stuck near Baltimore for 3 weeks
50.article_body: Evergreen Marine Corporation's 1,096-foot container ship 'Ever Forward' ran aground in the Chesapeake Bay after departing the Port of Baltimore's Seagirt Marine Terminal on March 13 and hasn't moved since, according to Bloomberg. After two failed attempts, Evergreen is planning another attempt as early as Sunday to free the ship. In 2021, Evergreen's 'Ever Given' ship blocked the Suez Canal.

51.title: PM meets Russian Foreign Minister in Delhi, briefed about situation in Ukraine
51.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday met Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov during the latter's official two-day visit and was briefed on the situation in Ukraine, including the ongoing peace negotiations. The Prime Minister's Office said PM reiterated his call for early cessation of violence and conveyed India's readiness to contribute in any way to the peace efforts.

52.title: John Abraham advised me 'Learn when to say no': Raashii Khanna
52.article_body: Actress Raashii Khanna has revealed that her 'Madras Cafe' co-star John Abraham advised her to learn when to say no and take it seriously in life. The actress added that this is exactly what she has done in her professional life. She further said that she didn't fill the gaps in her career with films she didn't want to do.

53.title: Afghanistan appoints ex-Pakistan pacer Umar Gul as bowling coach
53.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Umar Gul has been appointed as Afghanistan's bowling coach and consultant. "Looking forward to imparting the best of...knowledge that I have and making it worth it for the boys," Gul wrote on Twitter. He'll be joining team's national camp on April 4. Gul represented Pakistan in 47 Tests, 130 ODIs and 60 T20Is and took 427 wickets.

54.title: 3 terrorist associates of JeM arrested in Pulwama, ammunition seized
54.article_body: Three terrorist associates of Jaish-e-Mohammed were arrested by the police in the Pulwama district of J&K on Friday. A preliminary probe revealed that they were involved in providing logistics and transportation to terrorists in the district, reports said quoting police. Incriminating materials, weaponry and ammunition, including an AK rifle and a grenade, were seized from their possession.

55.title: US' oldest active park ranger retires at 100
55.article_body: The US' oldest active park ranger, Betty Reid Soskin, has retired at the age of 100 on Thursday, National Park Service said. Soskin had worked at Rosie the Riveter/WWII Home Front National Historical Park, which honours women who worked in factories during wartime, in California. "Betty has made a profound impact on the National Park Service," Director Chuck Sams said.

56.title: Centre sought ₹7.5 cr for military sent during Pathankot attack: Punjab CM
56.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday alleged that he had received a letter from the Centre, saying that Punjab must pay ₹7.5 crore for the military that was sent during the 2016 Pathankot attack. "I went to Rajnath Singh. Told him to deduct from my MPLAD but give in writing that Punjab isn't the country's part," he added.

57.title: NASA observatory studies neighbouring galaxy from Chile
57.article_body: NASA's Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) collected data on the Large Magellanic Cloud, one of the closest galaxies to our Milky Way from Santiago, Chile. "This mission here in Chile will help us...produce a very important science paper on the Magellanic Cloud characteristics in the near future," said Ed Harmon, manager of operations for SOFIA.

58.title: Bhuvan Bam apologises as NCW seeks FIR against him for 'objectifying' women in video
58.article_body: After the NCW requested the Delhi Police to file an FIR against YouTuber and actor Bhuvan Bam for allegedly objectifying women in a video, he issued an apology. "I'm aware that a section in my video has hurt some people. I have edited it to remove that part," said Bhuvan. The video titled 'Automatic Gaadi' has over 12 million views.

59.title: Online wildlife trade rose by 74% from 2020-2021 in Myanmar: WWF
59.article_body: A report by World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) has found that online illegal wildlife trade in Myanmar increased by 74% from 2020 to 2021. A total of 173 species, including 54 species that are threatened with global extinction, were traded during the same period. The report claimed that 11,046 wildlife items were promoted for sale through social media posts.

60.title: Jaya holds screening of Abhishek Bachchan's 'Dasvi' for MPs
60.article_body: Actress-turned-politician Jaya Bachchan organised a special screening of her son actor Abhishek Bachchan's upcoming film 'Dasvi' for her fellow Members of the Parliament in Mumbai. Maharashtra MP Rajani Patil and Maharashtra MP and deputy leader of Shiv Sena Priyanka Chaturvedi took to social media to share pictures from the event. 'Dasvi' was earlier screened for inmates in Agra Central Jail.

61.title: Had to fight for respect: Kim on divorce with Kanye, relationship with Pete
61.article_body: American television personality Kim Kardashian has stated that she "absolutely" feels like she had to fight to gain respect from others. Her statement comes amid her divorce with rapper Kanye West and relationship with comedian Pete Davidson. Kim further said, "It's hard to live your life on a reality show and then say I want certain things to be private."

62.title: Russia withdraws some troops in Ukraine's Chernihiv, Kyiv: Report
62.article_body: Governors of Ukraine's Chernihiv and Kyiv on Friday said some of the Russian troops are withdrawing from their regions. "We are observing the movement of joint Russian vehicle columns of various quantities," Kyiv region's governor, Oleksandr Pavlyuk said. Meanwhile, Chernihiv Governor Viacheslav Chaus said some Russian troops had pulled back but some remained in the region.

63.title: IIFA Awards 2022 nominees revealed, 'Shershaah' leads with 12 nominations
63.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani-starrer 'Shershaah' has topped the IIFA Awards 2022 nominations with 12 nominations, including Best Picture, Best Actor and Best Actress among others. Other nominees for Best Picture are - '83', 'Sardar Udham', 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and 'Thappad'. Ranveer Singh, Vicky Kaushal, Late Irrfan Khan, Vidya Balan, Kriti Sanon and others bagged nominations.

64.title: Even they never win: Akhtar on similarity between PBKS and Lahore Qalandars
64.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said that IPL's PBKS are similar to Lahore Qalandars from Pakistan Super League (PSL) as both teams weren't able to win their respective leagues. "Finally, this year they [Lahore Qalandars] won...final. So I hope that like Punjab from our side, even...Punjab from your side should do something," he stated. PBKS won their opening match against RCB.

65.title: BJP should hold 'charcha' on UP paper leak: Priyanka Gandhi
65.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday said the BJP should hold a discussion on the UP paper leak incident. Her remarks came after the UP Secondary School Board's Class 12 English examination was cancelled in 24 districts on Wednesday following the leak of the question paper. Priyanka said, "The paper leak system has a strong foothold in the government."

66.title: Sustainability board proposes new standards for company emissions
66.article_body: The International Sustainability Standards Board (ISSB) on Thursday set out its first guidelines for company sustainability reporting. The ISSB proposed two new standards with the first of them setting general sustainability related financial disclosures. While the second one details specific climate-related disclosure requirements which means data on the company's direct and indirect emissions.

67.title: Nepalese PM arrives in India on 3-day visit, meets BJP chief Nadda
67.article_body: Nepalese PM Sher Bahadur Deuba arrived in India on Friday for his three-day visit to the country. BJP chief JP Nadda welcomed him at the party's headquarters in Delhi. Deuba also met External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar today, while on Saturday, he will meet PM Narendra Modi. Notably, this is Deuba's first visit to India since assuming office last year.

68.title: Working with John isn't like actor-director thing: 'Attack' director
68.article_body: 'Attack' director Lakshya Raj Anand has stated that working with John Abraham isn't like "an actor-director thing", adding that they are one team. "Our main point was to get amazing action scenes, shoot it at...higher scale and give audiences a new way of storytelling," he added. Lakshya further said that he and John created the idea for the film together.

69.title: Nepal PM Deuba visits India for 1st time after assuming post
69.article_body: Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba visited India for the first time after assuming the position for the fifth time. Along with PM Deuba, his spouse and a delegation of 50 members including Foreign Minister Narayan Khadka have also arrived in the country. During the visit, Deuba is scheduled to meet PM Narendra Modi and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar.

70.title: KKR, PBKS announce their playing XIs, both teams make one change each
70.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 match on Friday. KKR have made one change to their playing XI, with Shivam Mavi replacing Sheldon Jackson. PBKS have also made one change to their team, with Kagiso Rabada replacing Sandeep Sharma.

71.title: Let me firmly confirm I haven't quit 'The Kapil Sharma Show': Sumona
71.article_body: Actress Sumona Chakravarti, addressing rumours of not being a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', stated, "Let me firmly confirm that I haven't quit...and don't intend to do it either." The actress will be seen in travel show 'Shonar Bangla' which will feature her exploring West Bengal. "The...show is a short one-month commitment that facilitates...my [passion for] travel," Sumona added.

72.title: Venkatesh seemed fidgety in KKR's last game vs RCB: Jaffer
72.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said KKR opener Venkatesh Iyer looked "fidgety" and under pressure to score runs in the last match against RCB in IPL 2022. "He played some strange shots. I guess he couldn't get used to the bounce at DY Patil Stadium," he added. Venkatesh, who scored 14-ball 10, was caught and bowled by Akash Deep.

73.title: Hyd Police seizes 900 gm of poppy straw concentrate, 2 arrested
73.article_body: Hyderabad Police caught two interstate drug peddlers on Thursday and recovered around 900 grams of poppy straw concentrate from them. Police also seized a car, cash and mobiles worth a total of ₹15 lakh. According to police, one of the accused procured drugs from Punjab and delivered them to the second accused in Hyderabad, who then sold them to customers.

74.title: Papa Johar will cry in hiding: Kangana as 'Lock Upp' hits 200mn views
74.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to announce that her reality show 'Lock Upp' has crossed 200 million views. She wrote, "Sari changu mangu sena/ media of cruella/ papa jo along with him going to cry chup chup ke (The army of chipmunks/ media of Cruella/ Papa Johar along with himself are going to cry in hiding)."

75.title: Free libraries being set up in Mumbai parks to encourage kids to read
75.article_body: The BMC is setting up free libraries in 24 parks in each of the 24 Mumbai wards on trial basis with an aim to inculcate reading habits in children. The initiative is a part of several activities being taken up under CSR, Additional Municipal Commissioner Ashwini Bhide said. Other programmes, such as musical mornings and evenings, are also being implemented.

76.title: Pope apologises to Canada's indigenous for abuses at church-run schools
76.article_body: Pope Francis apologised for the "deplorable" abuses suffered by indigenous people in Canada in the church-run residential schools. More than 1.5 lakh native children in Canada attended the residential schools from the 1800s until the 1990s as part of a government policy of forced assimilation. Many of the children were subjected to abuse, rape and malnutrition at the schools.

77.title: EAM defends buying Russian oil at event with UK minister, says 'most buyers in Europe'
77.article_body: EAM S Jaishankar defended India's decision to buy Russian oil at discounted rates in the presence of UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss. He said that in March (after Ukraine's invasion started) Europe bought 15% more oil and gas from Russia than a month before. "If you look at major buyers of oil and gas from Russia....most...are in Europe", he added.

78.title: Our meeting happening in difficult int'l environment: Jaishankar to Lavrov
78.article_body: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar in a conversation with Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on Friday said that they are meeting "in a difficult international environment". Lavrov landed in India on Thursday, his first visit since Russia invaded Ukraine. Meanwhile, Lavrov said Indo-Russia ties are very sustainable. "We are interested in having a balanced world order," Lavrov stated.

79.title: He clearly hasn't learnt anything: Sunil Gavaskar on CSK's Shivam Dube
79.article_body: Reacting to all-rounder Shivam Dube conceding 25 runs in the 19th over against LSG in CSK's second straight defeat in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said, "He clearly hasn’t learnt anything." Gavaskar added, "He has played a fair bit of limited-overs cricket and he is still bowling those length balls. He is going to get punished."

80.title: Future of KKR is bright under Shreyas' captaincy: Irfan Pathan
80.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said that two-time IPL champions KKR's future is bright under Shreyas Iyer's captaincy, adding the glimpses of which were seen in the first couple of matches in IPL 2022. "He is...players' captain. He backs the players at every turn, which is a good sign of a leader," Irfan added. KKR will face PBKS today.

81.title: Viewing deck at Mumbai's Girgaum Chowpatty 'illegal': BJP's Rane
81.article_body: The ₹2.5 crore viewing deck, being constructed on a stormwater drain at the BR Tambe Square over the Girgaum Chowpatty in Mumbai, has been called "illegal" by the opposition. BJP leader Nitesh Rane, in a letter to BMC, alleged that pillars were erected in the sea without permission under CRZ norms, adding that "it...effectively damaged the ecosystem in the sea."

82.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa centre busted at Ghaziabad mall
82.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa centre at Mahagun mall located in Vaishali. Police said they'd received an obscene video of the spa centre, following which they raided the centre and arrested nine people on Friday. The arrested persons include four women and the manager of the spa centre.

83.title: Why shouldn't I buy if there's a discount?: FM on India buying Russian oil
83.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman at a CNBC-TV18 event said that India has already started buying oil from Russia and has bought at least 3-4 days of supply. She asked, "Why shouldn't I buy (oil) if supply is available at a discounted rate?" She added, "I would put my country's national interest and energy security first."

84.title: Beautiful that narratives are built around it: Ashwin on 2019 incident with Buttler
84.article_body: On being asked about his first interaction with Jos Buttler at RR, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "He said 'Hi', I said 'Hi' again and we ended up having a very good chat about the state of cricket around the world." "It's beautiful and cute...that narratives are built around incidents like this," he added, referring to 2019 run-out incident with Buttler.

85.title: Tamil Nadu CM visits Delhi govt schools & mohalla clinics with Kejriwal
85.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin visited Delhi government schools and mohalla clinics with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday. "They were amazed by the school and all the facilities that we have," the headmistress of one school said. Stalin said his government will establish a world-class government model school in Chennai and he has invited Kejriwal in advance.

86.title: IAF's Suryakiran to hold fly-past over Hyderabad tomorrow
86.article_body: The Indian Air Force's Suryakiran Aerobatic Team, which will be conducting a fly-past over Hyderabad on April 2, has invited people to participate in a competition for the best picture taken during the event. "Shutterbugs prepare...Online competition is on... the best-tagged photo over the city wins...personalised hamper," the team tweeted along with the route and timings of the flypast.

87.title: Google unfairly blocked rival payment apps on Play Store, CCI reportedly finds
87.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that Google's billing system for app developers is "unfair and discriminatory", Bloomberg reported. "Google's conduct is also resulting in denial of market access to competing UPI apps," the CCI said in its preliminary report. This could lead to a situation where Google Pay's rivals are excluded from market in long run, it added.

88.title: 9 doctors of Navi Mumbai hospital injured after lift falls suddenly
88.article_body: As many as nine doctors of Amale Hospital in New Panvel in Navi Mumbai were injured after the lift fell down suddenly into the shaft after reaching the second floor. "The impact of the fall was high and doctors received injuries and they were admitted to different hospitals. All of them are out of danger," a fire department official said.

89.title: India can support process of mediation between Russia & Ukraine: Lavrov
89.article_body: Speaking about the possibility of India mediating between Russia and Ukraine, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on Friday called India an "important country". "If India seeks to play that role which provides resolution of the problem...If India is with its position of a just and rational approach to international problems, it can support such a process," said Lavrov.

90.title: Sale of non-vegetarian food banned in Pune's Dehu: Report
90.article_body: The civic body of Dehu in Pune, where the Marathi saint-poet Tukaram lived, has banned the sale of non-vegetarian food like meat and fish, PTI reported. Dehu Nagar Panchayat's chief officer Prashant Jadhav said, "The decision has been taken considering the sentiments of...locals and...devotees of Sant Tukaram." He said a flying squad has been formed to monitor the ban's implementation.

91.title: He's a champion: Malinga on Bravo becoming leading wicket-taker in IPL
91.article_body: After CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo (171) overtook Lasith Malinga (170) as the leading wicket-taker in IPL's history, the ex-Sri Lanka pacer and RR fast-bowling coach said, "Bravo is a champion." He tweeted, "More to go young man!" The 38-year-old achieved this feat against LSG at Brabourne Stadium on Thursday. Bravo has taken 171 wickets in 153 matches so far.

92.title: 'The Kashmir Files' no longer a film, it's a movement: Karan Johar
92.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has stated that Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' is no longer a film, it's a movement. The filmmaker added that the film is probably going to be cost-to-profit the biggest hit in Indian cinema. "You have got to acknowledge there is something that is connecting with this nation and academically you have to watch it," Karan stated.

93.title: 30-35 yrs of rivalry with Ram Charan turned to friendship: Jr NTR
93.article_body: Actor Jr NTR in an interview has stated that over 30-35 years of rivalry between himself and actor Ram Charan has turned into friendship after SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. He further said that their rivalry is very positive. "The whole scenario has changed after 'RRR' and Ram Charan and I are best friends now," the actor added.

94.title: New video claims to show reaction of Will Smith's wife after he slapped Chris
94.article_body: A new video has surfaced on social media, claiming to show actor Will Smith's actress-wife Jada Pinkett Smith's reaction after her husband slapped comedian Chris Rock at the Oscars over a joke about her alopecia condition. In the video, Jada seems to laugh after Chris says, "Will Smith just smacked the s*** out of me."

95.title: I just wanted to be back alive: Pune woman on being stuck in Ukraine
95.article_body: Shivani Lonkar, a third-year student of medicine in Kyiv, last week returned from war-torn Ukraine to her house in Pune. Talking about being stuck in Ukraine, 20-year-old Lonkar said, "[I] just wanted to be back alive." Stating that her last days in Ukraine left her scarred, Lonkar said, "Even if a cracker [bursts outside], it...takes...back to those days and emotions."

96.title: Railway Division takes over maintenance of Pune railway station
96.article_body: The Railway Division has taken over the management and maintenance of the railway station in Pune city. This comes after contracts made with the Indian Railway Stations Development Corporation Limited (IRSDC) for the management and maintenance ended. Work "related to catering and food stalls will be handed over to IRCTC", a Railway Division spokesperson said.

97.title: I'm not that rich: CEO of world's largest crypto exchange on $74 billion net worth
97.article_body: After Fortune magazine featured world's largest crypto exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao on its cover, the billionaire wrote, "[I'm] really not that rich, but honoured to be featured on the cover." The magazine had mentioned that the 44-year-old's estimated net worth is $74 billion and that Bitcoin boom had made him as rich as Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg "virtually overnight".

98.title: Dialogue should resolve disputes: Jaishankar in meeting with Lavrov
98.article_body: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar in a meeting with his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov underlined that disputes should be resolved through dialogue and diplomacy. Lavrov's visit to India comes weeks after Russia invaded Ukraine. Jaishankar emphasised the importance of cessation of violence and spoke about respecting international law, the UN Charter and territorial integrity of states.

99.title: I don't want to take pressure with my next performance: Sharvari Wagh
99.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh while talking about her upcoming project, said, "I don't want to take any pressure with my next performance." "I don't think any creative process can be justified after taking pressure of what the end result is going to be like," she added. The actress made her debut with 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'.

100.title: Google gave $12 mn fine for blocking us on YouTube: Russian TV channel
100.article_body: Tsargrad TV, a channel owned by sanctioned Russian businessman Konstantin Malofeev, has said Google has paid $12 million fine over its failure to restore access to Tsargrad's YouTube account. In March, the channel said Google lost an appeal against a 2021 ruling that it pay a daily $1,203 fine for blocking the account.

101.title: Netflix to relaunch 'Spy Kids', Robert Rodriguez to return as director
101.article_body: Netflix is all set to relaunch the 'Spy Kids' franchise. The streaming service has teamed up with Robert Rodriguez, the filmmaker who created the early 2000s family action-comedy movie series, to relaunch and reimagine the franchise for a new generation. The films featured Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino, Alexa PenaVega and Daryl Sabara.

102.title: Worried about Alia because she is too much too soon: Karan Johar
102.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar in a recent interview said he is worried about Alia Bhatt because she might have gotten 'too much too soon'. "Shah Rukh once said that...she will always have to be at the top of her game," Karan added. The filmmaker further said that he does not deserve any credit for Alia's achievements.

103.title: Delhi man threatens woman to kidnap her for rejecting his proposal; held
103.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly threatened a woman to kidnap her and to make her morphed pictures viral for rejecting his proposal, police said. Acting on the woman's complaint, police arrested him and found that he'd created multiple fake accounts on Instagram and had been stalking several accounts on the platform. Police have blocked five fake Instagram accounts belonging to him.

104.title: Kriti's sister Nupur to star in Ravi Teja's 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'
104.article_body: Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon has been roped in for Ravi Teja's first pan-India film, 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'. It is a biopic of Tiger Nageswara Rao, a thief of Stuartpuram in the 1970s. The film, which will be directed by Vamsee, will release in Telugu, Tamil, Kannada, Malayalam and Hindi. It'll be bankrolled by 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal.

105.title: Supermodel Bella Hadid to make acting debut with Hulu's 'Ramy'
105.article_body: Supermodel Bella Hadid is set to make her acting debut with Hulu's Emmy-nominated comedy series 'Ramy'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the 25-year-old model has been booked for a recurring guest star role on the forthcoming third season of the show. Created by and starring Ramy Youssef, the show is reportedly loosely based on his life.

106.title: Over 24 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
106.article_body: More than 24 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since the war began, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said on Friday. Around 23,000 people had entered the country from Ukraine on Thursday, it added. Numbers crossing the border have fallen significantly, with Thursday seeing the third-lowest number of crossings since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

107.title: Fan runs towards shirtless Messi, grabs him around neck to click selfie; video goes viral
107.article_body: A fan invaded the ground and ran towards shirtless Lionel Messi to click a selfie following Ecuador's 1-1 draw against Argentina. The fan took to his Instagram to share the selfie and a video. In the video, the fan can be seen grabbing Messi around the neck for taking a picture before the security personnel intervened.

108.title: Ukraine to receive super-modern equipment to protect skies: Envoy
108.article_body: Ukraine's ambassador to Japan, Sergiy Korsunsky, said Ukraine will soon be able to better protect its skies and cities from Russian attacks because it expects to receive "super-modern" equipment from US and Britain. "When they [Russia] fire cruise missiles from long distance, we cannot get to...launch place. We've to intercept them. That's why we need this modern equipment," Korsunsky added.

109.title: Manik Saha becomes BJP's first-ever Rajya Sabha MP from Tripura
109.article_body: Tripura BJP President Manik Saha was elected to the Rajya Sabha on Friday, making him the party's first-ever member in the Upper House of the Parliament from the state of Tripura. The dental surgeon-turned politician defeated his nearest rival CPI(M)’s Bhanulal Saha by 25 votes. Manik got 40 votes in his favour, 33 of which came from the BJP itself.

110.title: I was offered 200 scripts in the last three months, I chose 5: Nawazuddin
110.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has said that in the last three months, he was approached for as many as "200 scripts". He added, "But I chose only five films after much deliberation." About the process of selection, he said, "I listen to one-liners...if I am interested then I tell my assistant to give me a narration of the story."

111.title: Glad I didn't get an MBA, experience is the best teacher: Marico Founder
111.article_body: Harsh Mariwala, the Founder of 'Parachute' oil maker Marico, revealed that he was an average student and shy and neither of those qualities helped him when he wanted to join a B-school. "Initially, I regretted not getting an MBA. But in hindsight, I'm glad I didn't. Experience is the best teacher you can have," the 72-year-old businessman wrote on Twitter.

112.title: Dhawan weak against balls that nip away, Umesh won't spare him: Akhtar
112.article_body: Discussing IPL 2022's upcoming match between KKR and PBKS, Shoaib Akhtar said, "With the new ball, Umesh Yadav will not spare Shikhar Dhawan. His deliveries also pitch and nip away, which is Dhawan's weakness." "Our favourite IPL team is PBKS because even we have a PSL team from Punjab...which is Lahore Qalandars, and even they too never win," added Akhtar.

113.title: 22-yr-old abducted son of police officer found murdered in Bihar
113.article_body: A partially decomposed body of the 22-year-old son of a Bihar Police officer, abducted from Naugachia in Bihar's Bhagalpur district on March 28, was found in an agricultural field on Thursday, police said. His abductors reportedly demanded ₹45 lakh ransom from his family. "My daughter pleaded...to bring down the ransom...but he said it was non-negotiable," the victim's mother told police.

114.title: I feel like winning at life: Krishna Shroff on comparison with Tiger
114.article_body: Krishna Shroff in a recent interview said she takes it as a compliment when people compare her with her brother Tiger Shroff. "Any comparison with my superhero of a brother is a win in its own right," Krishna told Hindustan Times. "I feel like I'm doing something right. I am winning at life right then and there," she added.

115.title: On my way to Kyiv: European Parliament President amid conflict
115.article_body: European Parliament President Roberta Metsola on Friday tweeted that she is travelling to Ukraine's capital Kyiv in a show of support for the country amid the Russian invasion. Further details of Metsola's trip have been withheld due to security reasons, her spokesperson said. Metsola "will pass a message of support and hope on behalf of...European Parliament", the spokesperson added.

116.title: IPL is doing untold damage to the rest of cricket: Ex-Eng player Lloyd
116.article_body: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd said IPL is a lucrative tournament which is fantastic in terms of quality, but it is doing untold damage to the rest of cricket. "There's no room for Test cricket. In future, we will only see the iconic series like the Ashes..., England vs India," added Lloyd. "I worry...about the future of Test...cricket," stated Lloyd.

117.title: Enjoyed every minute of watching Babar's century: Labuschagne
117.article_body: Australian batter Marnus Labuschagne has confessed that he "enjoyed every minute of watching" Pakistan captain Babar Azam's match-winning knock of 114 runs in the second ODI against Australia. "That was a very good innings. I sat back... took some things on board for my own game," Labuschagne said. Pakistan chased down 349 runs with six wickets in hand on Thursday.

118.title: Researchers test far-UVC lamps that kill pathogens including coronavirus
118.article_body: Researchers have developed and tested far-Ultraviolet-C (UVC) radiation lamps to kill COVID-19-like viruses and other bacteria safely without harming human tissues. As per the study, using five far-UVC lamps, researchers eliminated 98% of airborne microbes in a room in less than five minutes. Regular UVC lamps, which are widely used to disinfect surfaces harm human skin and eyes.

119.title: Suryakumar is available for selection: Zaheer ahead of MI vs RR
119.article_body: MI Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said batter Suryakumar Yadav is available for selection ahead of MI's match against RR in IPL 2022. Suryakumar missed the opening game of MI against DC but he's declared fit now. He had suffered a hairline fracture in the third T20I against West Indies in February. The match will be played on Saturday.

120.title: We are entertainers, not cricketers: Chris Lynn backs PBKS' approach
120.article_body: Discussing PBKS' style, ex-KKR opener Chris Lynn said, "We are not cricketers, we are entertainers. I want to see plenty of sixes and plenty of fours. So, keep going PBKS." "The team that has the most big overs...wins the match," added Lynn. PBKS beat RCB by five wickets in their IPL 2022 opener, chasing a target of 206.

121.title: Eng must be 'close to perfect' to win WC 2022: Gareth Southgate
121.article_body: England manager Gareth Southgate believes that his side can win the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Qatar provided they are "close to perfect". "To do that is incredibly difficult and we'll have to be as close to perfect as can be. That's the challenge," Southgate said. "We will be a team... other teams wouldn't look forward to playing," he added.

122.title: 'Sharmaji...' is Rishi's film, I'm just there to complete his dream: Paresh
122.article_body: Actor Paresh Rawal, who completed 'Sharmaji Namkeen' after Rishi Kapoor's demise, has said, "[It's] Rishiji's film...I'm just there to complete his dream." "Rishiji was the finest human being I have come across," he added. "I wanted to make sure that I completed his film without vandalising or disrupting his presence," Paresh further said.

123.title: Yorkshire club allowed to continue to host matches at Headingley
123.article_body: Yorkshire County Cricket Club can continue to host international matches at the Headingley Cricket Ground after its members voted in favour of governance reforms. The club was barred from staging international matches in the wake of a racism scandal. The ECB had revoked the ban on the condition that the club will get its structural changes approved by its members.

124.title: Not upset with Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil: Maharashtra CM
124.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday dismissed reports of being upset with Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil. "I've full faith in Patil," his office said. There have been speculations that Thackeray was upset with Patil, an NCP leader, over the latter's response to former state CM Devendra Fadnavis's allegations that the state government was hatching a conspiracy against Opposition leaders.

125.title: Russian Foreign Minister to meet PM Modi today, confirms MEA
125.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs confirmed on Friday that Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov will meet PM Narendra Modi later today. Lavrov reached India on Thursday after his two-day visit to China. Earlier today, Lavrov met External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar and discussed the ongoing developments pertaining to Ukraine. He informed Jaishankar about Russia's perspective, MEA added.

126.title: Mom sacrificed career for dad, he didn't give credit: Irrfan's son Babil
126.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan in an interview has stated that his mother Sutapa Sikdar sacrificed her career to raise him and his brother and to make sure Irrfan's work continued uninterrupted. "Baba was Baba because Mumma was Mumma. He'd be nothing without her. And I don't think she gets enough credit. Not even from Baba," Babil said.

127.title: Creating model schools in Tamil Nadu on lines of Delhi: CM MK Stalin
127.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that his government have been giving "highest priority" to education and they are creating model schools in the southern state on lines of Delhi. Stalin visited a Delhi government school today along with his Delhi counterpart Arvind Kejriwal where officials briefed him about the change in education system in the city under AAP government.

128.title: Celebrate exams as festivals: PM to students during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'
128.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, during his 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' address, urged students to stay away from an environment of panic during examinations. "April is a month full of festivals. But between celebrating these festivals, we have to focus on exams. So why shouldn't we celebrate exams as festivals?" the PM said. "Students should not feel they are under pressure," he added.

129.title: 20 children hospitalised after consuming midday meal at Bihar school
129.article_body: At least 20 school children were hospitalised when they fell ill after allegedly consuming contaminated midday meals at a school in Bihar's Madhepura district. According to an official, the children complained of stomach cramps and vomiting. The children's parents have alleged that ever since an NGO began supplying food to schools, the children have complained about its bad quality.

130.title: 54 arrested after violent protests outside Sri Lankan President's home
130.article_body: About 54 people were arrested in Sri Lanka after violent protests outside President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's home, asking him to resign over his handling of the ongoing economic crisis. Rajapaksa's office blamed "organized extremists" within the group of demonstrators for violence during Thursday night's protests. An overnight curfew, imposed in some parts of Colombo after protests, has been lifted.

131.title: We've become 'jananis': Arjun Kapoor on rumours about relationship
131.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor, speaking about rumours of his relationship with Malaika Arora, said that people have become 'jananis' (gossiping women). "We all want to discuss 'When will they get married? They don't look good together. You think this is going to last? What does she see in him? Look at the way he's looking. Career will be ruined'," Arjun added.

132.title: Karnataka government 'most corrupt' in the country: Rahul Gandhi
132.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP-led Karnataka government and alleged that 40% Karnataka government is the "most corrupt" administration in the country. While addressing a rally in Bengaluru, he said, "If PM Modi comes to Karnataka and says that he wants to fight corruption, the entire state will start laughing. This is a 40 percent government."

133.title: Odisha extends additional free rice distribution for 6 more months
133.article_body: The Odisha government has extended the distribution of free rice to the beneficiaries of the State Food Security Scheme for six more months. As per the directive, each of the 8.09 lakh beneficiaries will get an additional 5 kg of rice from April to September 2022. The benefit under this scheme was earlier extended from December 2021 to March 2022.

134.title: 'Achhe din', ₹15 lakh in bank promises are April fool jokes: Raut
134.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday criticised the Centre over rising fuel prices following the Assembly elections, saying that the rulers always "make a fool" out of the common man. "Promises of 'achhe din', depositing ₹15 lakh into...bank accounts of citizens...and providing employment are nothing but April fool jokes," he added. The Centre should "stop lying", he further said.

135.title: Maruti Suzuki exports hit record high of 2.38 lakh units in FY22
135.article_body: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki revealed that its exports surged to 2.38 lakh units in FY22, the highest in any financial year. The company exported 26,496 units during March 2022, clocking its highest ever monthly exports. For the full financial year 2021-22, the company posted a total sales of 16.5 lakh units with a growth of 13.4% over FY 2020-21.

136.title: India has over 10 lakh EVs, 1,742 public charging stations: Gadkari to LS
136.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday told Lok Sabha that India has 10,76,420 electric vehicles (EVs) as of March 25, as per the Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE). There are 1,742 charging stations in public places that are operational, he added. "Action plans have been prepared by the BEE for eight cities with a four million-plus population," Gadkari added.

137.title: Man dies as garbage truck hits him in B'luru, 2nd such case in 10 days
137.article_body: A 76-year-old man died on Thursday after being hit by a speeding BBMP garbage truck in Bengaluru. The deceased was riding his scooter when the truck driver allegedly did not see him and knocked him down. This is the second such incident in the city, as a 14-year-old girl died after being hit by a BBMP garbage truck last week.

138.title: GST collections hit all-time high of ₹1.42 lakh crore in March 2022
138.article_body: The gross GST revenue collected in the month of March 2022 hit an all-time high of ₹1,42,095 crore, breaching the earlier record of ₹1,40,986 crore collected in January 2022, the government said on Friday. Of the ₹1,42,095 crore, CGST is ₹25,830 crore, SGST is ₹ 32,378 crore, IGST is ₹74,470 crore and cess is ₹9,417 crore.

139.title: Sensex ends 708 points higher at 59,277 on 1st day of new financial year
139.article_body: The Indian benchmark indices ended over 1% higher on the first day of the new financial year. The Sensex jumped 708 points to end at 59,277, while the broader Nifty 50 surged 206 points to close at 17,670.50. NTPC, Power Grid Corporation and IndusInd Bank were among the top Sensex gainers. Sensex added nearly 2,000 points this week.

140.title: 'The Irishman', 'The Sopranos' star Paul Herman passes away at 76
140.article_body: Paul Herman, the actor who starred in the show 'The Sopranos', has passed away at the age of 76. Robert De Niro, who worked with Herman in 'Goodfellas' and 'The Irishman', mourned his demise, saying that he was a wonderful actor and a dear friend. Herman made his acting debut in 1982 with 'Dear Mr. Wonderful'.

141.title: Ready to discuss if India wants to buy anything from us: Russia Foreign Minister
141.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov during his India visit said, "If India wants to buy anything from us, we are ready to discuss and reach mutually acceptable forms of cooperation." He was referring to the supply of oil and high technology. Earlier, reports said that sanctions-hit Russia had offered its oil at steep discounts to India amid the war.

142.title: Putin sends regards to PM Modi, I want to personally convey message: Lavrov
142.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, who's visiting India, on Friday said, "Our President (Vladimir Putin) has sent his best regards to PM Narendra Modi." He added that he would like to "personally" convey the message to PM Modi. Russian President and PM Modi have been in "regular touch" with each other, Lavrov added.

143.title: If I don't use my privilege, it's a waste: Irrfan's son Babil on nepotism
143.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil, speaking about nepotism, said that if he can't use his privilege and justify it through his craft, it'd be a waste. He further said the expectations from him are a mark of his privilege. "Either you can beat yourself up and feel guilty about it or accept it with humility," the actor added.

144.title: Raw sewage spills into English rivers and sea 1,000 times a day: Govt Data
144.article_body: Water companies have admitted they discharged raw sewage into English rivers and seas around 1,000 times a day last year, data by Environment Agency (EA) stated. The untreated sewage has been spilt 3,72,533 times in water bodies in 2021. Though the firms are permitted to do this during heavy rainfall, the EA said such frequent spills can affect water quality.

145.title: 2 cantonment hospitals in Pune to start Ayurveda clinics
145.article_body: The Ministry of Defence will start operating Ayurveda centres in two cantonment hospitals in Khadki and Dehu road in Pune district from May 1. The move is part of the ministry's initiative to start Ayurveda centres at 37 cantonment hospitals across the country. "The move will make available...time-tested therapies of Ayurveda to the residents of cantonments," the ministry said.

146.title: TMC MP Chhetri demands minority status for Hindus in Meghalaya
146.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Shanta Chhetri on Friday demanded the minority status for Hindus in Meghalaya. "I humbly urge the August House to draw the kind attention of the Home Minister to urgently direct the Meghalaya government to grant minority status to Hindus via a notification as per Articles 29 and 30 of the Constitution of India," Chhetri said.

147.title: Woman's version incomplete, she also sent sexualised texts: Paine on d**k pic scandal
147.article_body: Amid investigation into the d**k pic scandal, ex-Australia Test captain Tim Paine said that the woman's version of the exchange of messages between them is "incomplete and inaccurate". As per Cricket Tasmania, Paine said her messages also contained highly sexualised and explicit sexual content. The case could go to trial as mediation between the parties failed to settle the dispute.

148.title: Delhi Police gets 2 weeks to file status report on attack at CM's home
148.article_body: Delhi HC on Friday asked Delhi Police to file a status report within two weeks on the investigation it has carried out to date in connection to vandalism at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house. AAP alleged BJP workers orchestrated the attack over Kejriwal's comments on 'The Kashmir Files'. "You'll have to explain...what kind of threat perception was there," HC said.

149.title: Amazon has destroyed us: Future Retail to Supreme Court
149.article_body: Advocate Harish Salve, appearing for Future Retail in the Supreme Court, said, "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us." He was referring to the Amazon's litigation to block the ₹27,000-crore asset sale deal between Future and Reliance Retail. The court was hearing Amazon's plea to restrain Future from alienating its retail assets until arbitration between the companies concluded.

150.title: Pakistan was great when you were not the PM: Pak PM Imran Khan's ex-wife
150.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan's ex-wife Reham Khan tweeted, "Pakistan was great when you were not the PM." In an apparent jibe at the Pakistan PM, after he said that he has attained everything in life, Reham tweeted, "The man who has everything but intelligence." Reham's tweets came after the Pakistan PM said he won't resign ahead of the no-trust vote.

151.title: Sara, Vikrant visit Nageshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Gujarat
151.article_body: Actors Sara Ali Khan and Vikrant Massey on Thursday visited the Nageshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Gujarat. "Being there and helping me for har ek baat...Thank you...Jai Bholenath," Sara wrote on Instagram while sharing pictures from their visit. Sara and Vikrant are currently shooting for their upcoming film 'Gaslight' in Gujarat. The film is being directed by Pavan Kripalani.

152.title: They're important in IPL: Jaffer on PBKS' opening pair of Mayank-Shikhar
152.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said PBKS' opening pair of Mayank Agarwal and Shikhar Dhawan are very important for the team in IPL 2022. "They're a left-right combination...both are experienced players. Mayank can play his attacking game as he knows that Dhawan is a calming influence," he added. Skipper Mayank (32) and Dhawan (43) added 71-run first-wicket stand in their opener against RCB.

153.title: Japanese body extends ₹2,391 cr loan for B'luru sewage facilities
153.article_body: The Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) has signed an agreement with the Centre to give ₹2,391 crore as a loan for the construction of water supply and sewage facilities. This will be done under the Bengaluru Water Supply and Sewerage Board Project (Phase 3). JICA has been reportedly supporting such construction in Bengaluru and the surrounding areas since 1996.

154.title: Delhi constable's son among 4 held for gang-raping nurse in B'luru
154.article_body: A Delhi Police head constable's son is among four persons who were arrested for gang-raping a 23-year-old nurse in Bengaluru, a report stated. The incident allegedly occurred when the woman went to meet one of the accused, who she'd befriended on a dating app, at his house. All the accused are in their early 20s and are swimmers from Delhi-NCR.

155.title: India, Russia are good friends & loyal partners: Lavrov after meeting Jaishankar
155.article_body: After meeting External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar in Delhi, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said, "Indian foreign policies are characterised by independence and the concentration on real national legitimate interests." He said that the Russian Federation follows the same policy, adding, "This makes us (India and Russia), as big countries, good friends and loyal partners."

156.title: At least I didn't slap anybody: UK FM on criticism of his wife over Infosys stake
156.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak likened himself to Will Smith after his wife Akshata Murthy faced criticism for owning Infosys shares, which allegedly has a Russian presence. "At least I didn't get up and slap anybody, which is good," Sunak told BBC. He further said, "It's totally fine for people to take shots at me...It's...upsetting...for people to...come at my wife."

157.title: Mumbai court rejects plea of retired policeman in 1989 custodial rape case
157.article_body: The Mumbai sessions court has rejected the plea filed by a retired policeman, who was booked for raping a woman in his custody 33 years ago in 1989. The accused sought to discard the complainant's evidence on technical grounds. The court said the purpose of procedural law is to aid justice and isn't meant to cause a miscarriage of justice.

158.title: 16-year-old boy films female tuition teacher in bathroom in Pune
158.article_body: A 16-year-old boy has been booked for allegedly filming his female tuition teacher when she would use the toilet at his house in Pune. The teacher reportedly found the hidden phone in a soapbox and on checking it, also discovered old pictures and recordings of herself. The tutor had been teaching the boy since he was 10-11 years old.

159.title: Huma Qureshi to play lead role in chef Tarla Dalal's biopic
159.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi is set to play the lead role in the biopic of chef and cookbook author Tarla Dalal. The film is being jointly produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Nitesh Tiwari and Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari. According to reports, the film will be helmed by Piyush Gupta and is expected to go on floors in the coming few months.

160.title: Amazon opened 2nd humanitarian aid hub to help Ukrainians: Bezos
160.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to announce that the firm has opened a second humanitarian aid hub in Poland to help Ukrainian refugees. The firm's first hub for Ukrainian refugees is in Slovakia. The hub is a "fulfilment centre dedicated to this issue, using our logistics and distribution experience to help", Bezos explained.

161.title: Man dies of asphyxiation as fire breaks out at a house in Delhi
161.article_body: A 29-year-old man died as a house in Bindapur's Prem Nagar district in Delhi was gutted in fire on Friday morning. According to the police, the deceased, Lalit, was trying to escape the fire that broke out in the house at 5:15 am when he died of asphyxiation. The reason behind the fire is not known yet.

162.title: Nagaland lifts COVID-19 curbs, advises citizens to continue wearing masks
162.article_body: In view of the declining weekly sample positivity rate of COVID-19 infections in Nagaland, the state government has lifted all COVID-19 curbs with effect from April 1. However, as a precaution, citizens have been advised to continue adhering to COVID-19 appropriate behaviour like wearing face masks in public places, washing or sanitising hands and maintaining physical distancing at all times.

163.title: Volkswagen may allow Audi, Porsche to enter F1 next week: Report
163.article_body: Volkswagen is likely to allow Audi and Porsche to enter Formula One at a meeting next week, Reuters reported citing sources. Audi will offer around $556.30 million for McLaren, while Porsche intends to establish a partnership with racing team Red Bull starting in several years' time. McLaren said it has had some "very preliminary" conversations with VW in the past.

164.title: G-23 never sought a non-Gandhi Congress President: Kamal Nath
164.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath has claimed that the group of rebel Congress leaders, also known as G-23, has never demanded a Congress President outside the Gandhi family. "They (G-23) have been my colleagues for years. They have never made any such demand," Nath said. "They have asked for party elections... which will be held in three months' time," he added.

165.title: Playing for CSK is like a picnic, they do so much for players: Harbhajan
165.article_body: Ex-CSK spinner Harbhajan Singh said playing for the franchise feels like a picnic, adding that CSK take care of the needs of every member of the player's family, even if 10 people want to come. "The other teams don't do that," stated Harbhajan. "A player gets attached...when he sees that CSK are doing so much for him," said Harbhajan.

166.title: Anyone can meet him: KP Maurya on CM Yogi, Shivpal Yadav's meet
166.article_body: A day after PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav met UP CM Yogi Adityanath amid reports of rift with his nephew Akhilesh Yadav, Keshav Prasad Maurya said that Adityanath is the CM and "anyone can meet him". "Yogi Adityanath is CM of 24 crore population in UP. Anyone can meet him. Recently, he also met Akhilesh Yadav," the UP Deputy CM said.

167.title: Nishank to evict govt allotted residence for Scindia: Reports
167.article_body: Former Union Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank is likely to evict his government allotted accommodation (27, Safdarjung Road) soon to make room for Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, reports said. According to sources, Nishank isn't a minister anymore, which makes him ineligible for a bungalow, and a team of officials will be sent on Monday to begin the eviction process.

168.title: South Korean Air Force planes collide in mid-air; 4 killed
168.article_body: Two South Korean Air Force planes collided in mid-air during a training exercise on Friday, killing all four people aboard the aircraft, officials said. Both planes had taken off from an Air Force base in Sacheon city one after another for flight training. The collision occurred about five minutes after the first aircraft took off, the Air Force said.

169.title: Chris Evans & Scarlett to reunite for 'Project Artemis', Bateman to direct
169.article_body: Chris Evans and Scarlett Johansson are all set to star in 'Project Artemis', an upcoming Apple drama which will be directed by 'Ozark' actor Jason Bateman. According to Deadline, the project is set against the space race. Evans and Scarlett have worked together on several projects, including 'Avengers' and 'Captain America: Civil War'.

170.title: PWD to put roof covers on Pragati Maidan's tunnel in Delhi
170.article_body: The PWD has decided to install roof covers on the 1.36 kilometre-long Delhi's Pragati Maidan tunnel and six underpasses to avoid waterlogging, an official said. Notably, roof covers are being planned for all upcoming tunnels in Delhi, the official said. The tunnel, which will have an 80-metre-long and 5-metre-wide emergency lane, is being built to decongest the traffic.

171.title: Electricity tariffs increased by 2.68% in Uttarakhand: UERC
171.article_body: Electricity tariffs have been increased by 2.68% in the state, Uttarakhand Electricity Regulatory Commission (UERC) confirmed. The electricity rate has been hiked by ₹0.4 per unit for BPL and snowbound consumers, UERC informed. Accordingly, the revised domestic electricity rates are ₹2.90, ₹4.20, ₹5.80, ₹6.55 for 0-100 units, 101-200 units, 201-400 units, above 400 units categories, respectively.

172.title: Illegal business expenses of ₹800 crore found at Hero MotoCorp: I-T Dept
172.article_body: The Income Tax Department found illegal business expenses of over ₹800 crore after it conducted a search and seizure operation at Hero MotoCorp's premises. It said that ₹60 crore in "unaccounted" cash was used to purchase 10 acre of farm land in Delhi. "The ultimate...beneficiary of the land deal is a prominent person of the automobile manufacturer group," it added.

173.title: CSK could have won if dropped catches vs LSG were taken: Ravindra Jadeja
173.article_body: Reacting to CSK losing their first two matches of an IPL season for the first time ever after a defeat against LSG, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said they could have won if two catches dropped were taken. Moeen Ali dropped Quinton De Kock, while Tushar Deshpande failed to complete KL Rahul's catch during the match.

174.title: After Bombay HC order, provisional aggregator licence issued to Ola, Uber
174.article_body: Four cab service companies, including Ola and Uber, have been issued a provisional aggregator licence for operating taxi services in the city by  Mumbai Metropolitan Region Transport Authority (MMRTA). Notably, last month, the Bombay High Court had instructed all app-based cab aggregators to apply for a valid licence, after finding them without one, to continue operations in the city.

175.title: Telangana makes wearing masks optional, removes all COVID-19 curbs
