Paresh was roped in for the film after Rishi Kapoor, who was originally cast as the lead in the film, had passed away.

349.title: Spent 30% of Attack's budget on VFX, not on myself: John Abraham
349.article_body: Actor John Abraham, speaking about his upcoming film 'Attack', has said that 30% of the film's budget has been spent on the VFX. "Actor's fee is usually close to 50%...of the entire budget...In our case...we've not spent on John Abraham, we've spent on VFX," he stated. "I'm not in the race of charging the most or the least," he added.

350.title: Netherlands football coach Louis van Gaal tests positive for COVID-19
350.article_body: Netherlands football coach Louis van Gaal on Tuesday tested positive for COVID-19 ahead of two friendly international matches against Denmark and Germany. The Netherlands are three-time World Cup finalists, with Louis van Gaal leading the team to the semi-finals at the 2014 World Cup in Brazil. The Netherlands failed to qualify for the previous World Cup in Russia in 2018.

351.title: Chandigarh declares public holiday on Shaheed Diwas on March 23
351.article_body: The Chandigarh administration on Tuesday announced a public holiday on March 23 on the occasion of Bhagat Singh's death anniversary, also known as Shaheed Diwas. Earlier in the day, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had declared a public holiday on the occasion. Shaheed Diwas also marks the death anniversary of freedom fighters Sukhdev Thapar and Shivaram Rajguru.

352.title: Time to end Russia's "absurd war" in Ukraine: UN Secretary-General
352.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday said it's time to end the "absurd war" started by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Continuing war in Ukraine is morally unacceptable, politically indefensible and militarily nonsensical," he added. UN chief also urged to stop hostilities and called for serious negotiations. Meanwhile, at least 925 civilians were killed in Ukraine till March 20.

353.title: Will dig up & raze your houses if you hit poor: MP CM to criminals
353.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Tuesday that he will "dig up and raze" the houses of criminals if they raise their hand on poor people. Chouhan added that he won't let criminals live in peace. His comments come days after a clash broke out between two communities in the state's Raisen district, which lead to one death.

354.title: Delhi NCR developers plan to halt construction as raw material costs soar
354.article_body: Developers in Delhi NCR are planning to stop purchase of raw materials and construction activity due to rising raw material costs, according to industry body CREDAI NCR. "After COVID-19, the current crisis is a dual blow on real estate developers," said CREDAI NCR President Pankaj Bajaj. CREDAI members in Maharashtra are also planning to stop work for the same reason.

355.title: Dalit woman raped by 8, including 2 DMK members, for 7 months in TN
355.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police has arrested eight persons, including four minors and two DMK members, for allegedly raping a 22-year-old Dalit woman for nearly seven months in Virudhunagar. The main accused, Hariharan Mahendran, filmed his intimate moments with the victim and later showed it to his friends. The accused threatened to leak the videos and raped her repeatedly.

356.title: Video shows Farooq lashing out at media when asked about Kashmiri Pandits
356.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and National Conference veteran Farooq Abdullah was seen in a video lashing out at reporters in Parliament premises on Tuesday when asked about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits in the 1990s. "You (BJP) want to know the truth, you should appoint a commission," he said. When asked another question, he replied, "Don't push me."

357.title: BSE seeks clarification from Paytm's parent company over fall in share price
357.article_body: The BSE has sought a clarification from Paytm's parent company One 97 Communications Ltd over a fall in its share price. It said the clarification is sought to ensure that investors "have latest relevant information about the company and to inform the market". While the issue price of Paytm shares was ₹2,150, the price dropped to ₹543.90 in Tuesday's trade.

358.title: Rishi ji called me insecure actor on 'Sharmaji Namkeen' sets: Juhi
358.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla has revealed that late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor screamed at her on 'Sharmaji Namkeen' sets because she kept checking the monitor. "Chintu ji was like, 'Monitor is not meant for actors. Why are you behaving like an insecure actor?'" the actress said. Juhi added that she would crack up but still go and see the monitor.

359.title: Playing for ₹10 lakh or ₹10.75 cr in IPL doesn't matter: RCB's Harshal
359.article_body: RCB pacer Harshal Patel said he's going to play in IPL 2022 "exactly" the same way like he played last year and price tag of ₹10 lakh or ₹10.75 crore doesn't matter. "No new skills, all I...hope...is (that) I'm more precise in my execution," he added. Harshal was bought back by RCB for ₹10.75 crore in IPL mega auction 2022.

360.title: Authentication firm Okta probes report of digital breach
360.article_body: Okta is investigating report of a digital breach on its platform after hackers posted screenshots of what they said was the company's internal information. Okta had detected an attempt to compromise the account of a third party customer support engineer in January and believes this breach to be related, it said. The hackers belonged to ransom-seeking group known as LAPSUS$.

361.title: WhatsApp rolls out message reactions for Android Beta users
361.article_body: WhatsApp is releasing the 'Message Reactions' feature for some users on WhatsApp Beta for Android. Only certain beta testers have received the ability to test the feature which includes six emoji reactions. With another recently announced multi-device update for WhatsApp Web and WhatsApp Desktop, users can access the app on four devices without having the smartphone connected to the internet.

362.title: 21 flights cancelled at Bagdogra Airport due to damage on runway
362.article_body: Flight operations were halted as 21 flights were cancelled at Bagdogra International Airport in West Bengal's Siliguri after the damage was reported on the runway on Tuesday evening, Bagdogra Airport Director P Subramani said. He, however, said the morning operation "was okay as seven flights landed in the morning and five took off". Subramani added flights will operate normally tomorrow.

363.title: Sri Lankan Parliament approves amendments to anti-terrorism law
363.article_body: Sri Lankan Parliament on Tuesday approved amendments to the country's contentious anti-terrorism law. The amendments to the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) will include the reduction in the detention period of the accused and expedited hearing of cases. The law allows authorities to make warrantless searches and arrests if a person is suspected of being involved in terrorist activity.

364.title: UN General Assembly Special Session on Ukraine to resume on Wed
364.article_body: The Emergency Special Session of the UN General Assembly on Ukraine will resume on Wednesday, UNGA President Abdulla Shahid tweeted. The announcement was made after 22 member states, including France and the US, wrote a letter calling for the resumption of the session. A draft resolution sponsored by Ukraine and other member states is being processed, a UN official said.

365.title: I've played for so long, know what to talk: Raina on commentary debut in IPL
365.article_body: Speaking about his commentary debut in upcoming IPL, Suresh Raina said he'll enjoy it and feels it'll be exciting. "I've played for so long, so I know what to talk [about] and where...doing commentary is something I still need to learn. It'll be difficult," he added. Raina went unsold in IPL mega auction in February after being released by CSK.

366.title: Marilyn Monroe painting expected to fetch $200 million at auction
366.article_body: Auction house Christie's on Monday said a portrait of actress Marilyn Monroe by Andy Warhol called "Shot Sage Blue Marilyn" is expected to fetch an estimated record $200 million at auction. Christie's Chairman of 20th and 21st Century Art Alex Rotter said the work "is poised to be the most expensive painting of the 20th century ever sold at auction."

367.title: DMK worker & 4 minors, among 8 held for raping 22-yr-old woman in TN
367.article_body: The Virudhanagar Police on Monday arrested eight persons, including a DMK worker and four minors for allegedly raping a 22-year-old woman and threatening to release the video on social media. DMK leader Kanimozhi Karunanidhi said that it's "consoling" that the accused have been arrested. "Strong action has to be taken against the accused, no matter who they are," she added.

368.title: Pak, China sign 5 agreements to strengthen 'iron-clad friendship'
368.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi and his Pakistani counterpart Shah Mahmood Qureshi signed five bilateral cooperation agreements during a meeting in Pakistan's capital Islamabad on Monday. "Ways to further strengthen the iron-clad friendship between the two countries were discussed," the Pakistani Foreign Office said. Separately, the two ministers also discussed the conflict in Ukraine, it added.

369.title: Video captures moment when a tornado approaches Walmart store in US' Texas
369.article_body: A video has surfaced online that captured the moment when a tornado approached a Walmart store's parking lot in Texas, US on Monday. In the video, people can be seen running to take cover amid high-speed winds. A storm system that passed through Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama has reportedly left at least one person dead and 19 others hospitalised.

370.title: SRK's daughter Suhana, friend hide face inside car as media click pics
370.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana was seen hiding her face along with a friend inside their car while leaving Mannat as media persons clicked pictures on Tuesday. One of the pictures shows her talking to the driver while her friend kept his face hidden with his hand. Suhana will reportedly debut in Zoya Akhtar’s film based on 'Archies' comics.

371.title: Illegally built house of main accused of Shahdol gang-rape destroyed
371.article_body: The illegally built house of the main accused of the gang-rape of a 28-year-old woman in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district was destroyed on Tuesday, following the order of the district administration. According to the police, the woman was raped by three men on Saturday, who later fed her a poisonous substance, which led to her death in a hospital.

372.title: Centre seeks report from West Bengal govt after houses set on fire killing 8
372.article_body: After at least eight people were killed as houses were set on fire in West Bengal's Birbhum, the Centre sought a detailed report on the incident from the state government. Violence was reported from Boktui village after TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh was killed. CM Mamata Banerjee has asked the DGP to take immediate action against perpetrators of the violence.

373.title: Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai buys helicopter costing ₹100 crore
373.article_body: Dubai-based Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai, the Chairman of industrial development conglomerate RP Group, has bought an Airbus H145 helicopter costing ₹100 crore. The helicopter was delivered by Airbus in Kovalam and took its inaugural flight from Kovalam to The Raviz Ashtamudi. The helicopter is capable of landing and takeoff from even high altitudes of 20,000 feet above sea level.

374.title: BSP's votes shifted to BJP: SP leader on UP Assembly poll results
374.article_body: Reacting to the results of UP Assembly elections, Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Imran Masood alleged that the BJP benefitted from the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP). "It is a 100% fact that the BSP's votes transferred to the BJP," he said. Masood, who resigned from Congress to join SP before the polls, added that elections should be conducted using ballot papers.

375.title: India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage crosses 181.56 crore
375.article_body: The cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 181.56 crore on Tuesday, the Union Health Ministry said. Meanwhile, over 34 lakh children have so far been administered the vaccine against COVID-19, the ministry stated. Notably, India reported 1,581 new COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours. India's daily positivity rate stands at 0.28%.

376.title: Mere breach of contract is not in itself a criminal offence: SC
376.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that a mere breach of contract is not in itself a criminal offence and gives rise to the civil liability of damages. A bench comprising Justices S A Nazeer and Krishna Murari said the distinction between mere breach of contract and cheating, which is a criminal offence, is a fine one.

377.title: Will never impose sanctions against Russia: Serbian minister
377.article_body: Serbian Interior Minister Aleksandar Vulin on Tuesday said government will never impose sanctions against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine. "Serbia will never be part of the anti-Russian hysteria in which property of Russian citizens and property of Russian Federation is stolen..." added Vulin. Serbia is the only European nation that has refused to join international sanctions against Russia.

378.title: Lucknow Super Giants unveil their first jersey and theme song, share video
378.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), who will make their debut in IPL 2022, have unveiled their first jersey and theme song. The KL Rahul-led franchise will don a cyan-coloured jersey. Their theme song 'Ab apni baari hai' has been sung by Badshah, while its video has been directed and choreographed by Remo Dsouza.

379.title: Sonia holds talks with Congress' rebel leaders at her residence
379.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday held discussions with some rebel party leaders, also known as G-23, at her residence in Delhi. The party leaders included Anand Sharma and Manish Tewari. Gandhi is likely to meet some other leaders of the group in the coming days. The G-23 leaders have been demanding an organisational overhaul.

380.title: Passed trial by fire, will continue to oppose CAA: Ishrat after bail
380.article_body: Former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan, who was granted bail on March 14 in a Northeast Delhi riots case, said it was her "trial by fire" and that she will continue to oppose the CAA. The court, while granting her bail, stated that she wasn't physically present in Northeast Delhi during the riots, nor was she part of any organisation.

381.title: Non-stop calls overwhelming, I am even late for work: 19-year-old Pradeep
381.article_body: Pradeep Mehra, the 19-year-old McDonald's worker who went viral for running 10 kilometres every night from his Noida workplace to Barola to join the Army, said, "Who doesn't like attention? But you enjoy it more when you have spare time." He added, "However, I am busy running errands, so non-stop calls are overwhelming. I am even late for work!"

382.title: Might put Bappi Lahiri's gold collection in a museum: Bappa Lahiri
382.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri said they are going to preserve the late singer's gold collection. "Those [Gold] were not just fashion statements for dad, it was lucky for him...We want people to see his things...we might put them in a museum," he stated. Bappa added the late singer collected each of those gold pieces from around the world.

383.title: I'll try my best to keep him relaxed: Rashid on compatriot Noor at GT
383.article_body: Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan, who along with compatriot Noor Ahmad Lakanwal will be representing GT in IPL 2022, said he'll share his IPL experience with 17-year-old as it's a big stage, requiring mental strength. "I'll try my best to keep him relaxed," he added. Rashid further said that IPL is a "big opportunity" for fellow countryman Rahmanullah Gurbaz to learn.

384.title: 2 MP tribal welfare dept employees held for taking ₹80,000 bribe
384.article_body: Two employees of MP's Tribal Welfare Department were arrested on Tuesday for taking a bribe of ₹80,000. An official said the two accused were nabbed when they were accepting the amount from a hostel superintendent for releasing the scholarship amount of ST students in Shivpuri. They were identified as RS Parihar, Shivpuri District Coordinator (tribal welfare), and clerk Awdhesh Sharma.

385.title: 11 arrested after 8 killed as houses set on fire in WB's Birbhum
385.article_body: Eleven people have been arrested after eight persons, including two children, died in West Bengal's Birbhum district as nearly 10-12 houses were set ablaze. The incident happened hours after deputy gram pradhan of the Trinamool Congress was killed in a bomb attack on Monday night. "We are investigating...whether the incident is related to death of Trinamool panchayat leader," police said.

386.title: Nadal's Indian Wells semi-final was like an exam for him: Uncle Toni
386.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal's semi-final win against Carlos Alcaraz in Indian Wells, world number three's uncle Toni Nadal said the three hour-12 minute match was undoubtedly complicated for his nephew as if it were "an exam". Alcaraz hit 39 winners to Nadal's 20. The 21-time Grand Slam champion wasted 15 break-point opportunities before defeating the 18-year-old 6-4, 4-6, 6-3.

387.title: Floods kill 5 in Brazil a month after storms killed over 200
387.article_body: Authorities on Monday said heavy floods caused by torrential rain have killed at least five people in Brazil's Petropolis following a similar disaster that killed 233 people last month. Another four people have been declared missing since Sunday. Emergency officials said a month's worth of rain fell within a few hours on Sunday, damaging around 100 homes and causing landslides.

388.title: 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli' relies heavily on the performance: Rasika
388.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal has said that her upcoming film 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli' relies heavily on the performance. "That kind of challenge is a delight for an actor," she added. "There is so much meat for my character in the film that I sometimes felt I had traversed multiple genres within the same film," she further said.

389.title: 10 million people now homeless due to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
389.article_body: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) on Monday said nearly 6.5 million people have been internally displaced in Ukraine, on top of the 3.3 million that have escaped the country so far. The IOM's Director General Antonio Vitorino said the scale of human suffering and forced displacement of people due to the invasion "far exceeds any worst-case scenario planning."

390.title: Police register FIR against 4 for selling plots against norms in MP
390.article_body: Police have registered an FIR against four people for selling plots while allegedly violating town planning norms in Madhya Pradesh. An official said on Tuesday that the four accused as well as many others have also been reportedly prohibited from selling any plots further. The FIR had been ordered to be registered by Jabalpur DM Dr Ilayaraja T.

391.title: Cost of EVs to be at par with petrol-run vehicles in 2 years: Gadkari
391.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said cost of electric vehicles (EVs) will be at par with cost of petrol-run vehicles in two years. Emphasising on the need to shift to a cost-effective indigenous fuel, Gadkari said rapid strides in technology and green fuel will reduce EV costs. Cost of driving EVs will be about 1/10th of petrol vehicles, he added.

392.title: I'm not joining 'Lock Upp', I've done 'Bigg Boss': Rashami Desai
392.article_body: Actress Rashami Desai has stated that she is not going to be a contestant on Kangana Ranaut's reality television show 'Lock Upp'. "I've done a similar format show with 'Bigg Boss 15'...But a full-time association to the show is not what I'm currently looking at," she said. Rashami added that she would make a guest appearance if she is invited.

393.title: Payal couldn't be good leader, thus our team suffered: Babita Phogat
393.article_body: Following her eviction from the reality show 'Lock Upp', wrestler Babita Phogat has said that Saisha Shinde and Kaaranvir Bohra are the strongest contestants in the show. Speaking about actress Payal Rohatgi, who was her team's captain in the show, Babita said, "Payal could not be a good leader and thus our team suffered a bit."

394.title: Kashmir files can be reopened if there's a specific need: J&K DGP
394.article_body: On being asked if Kashmir files and cases related to the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the Valley can be reopened, J&K DGP Dilbag Singh said, "The files can be reopened if there's a specific need." "We have been pursuing and will keep pursuing any case related to terrorism. We will not spare anyone who is responsible." he added.

395.title: Things people didn't know came to public domain: J&K LG on Kashmir Files
395.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir Manoj Sinha on Tuesday reacted to the Anupam Kher-starrer 'The Kashmir Files' film and said "If someone makes a film, they have a perspective." Sinha said, "I think it is good that several things, which people did not know, have come to the public domain and people now have fresh knowledge of the same."

396.title: Don't make unwarranted statements: Mamata on Guv's 'arson orgy' remark
396.article_body: After Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar described the violence in West Bengal's Birbhum as 'arson orgy', CM Mamata Banerjee wrote to him asking him to refrain from making unwarranted statements. Banerjee said Dhankar's statements were unbecoming of a person holding a constitutional post and asked him to allow the administration to conduct an impartial probe. Eight people died in the violence.

397.title: Violence, arson orgy in Birbhum, WB in grip of lawlessness: Governor
397.article_body: Responding to the violence in Birbhum district, in which eight people died, West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said that the violence and "arson orgy" shows that the state is in a "grip of lawlessness". The violence erupted following the alleged murder of Bhadu Sheikh, the Deputy Chief of the Barshal gram panchayat, which is controlled by the Trinamool Congress.

398.title: People walking up to me for selfies, I feel shy: 19-yr-old Pradeep
398.article_body: After a clip of his midnight run in Noida went viral on social media, 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra said his world has changed overnight. "People are walking up to me and asking for selfies! I feel shy," he said. Mehra added, "It happened suddenly. Not in my dreams I expected my video to go viral and people chasing me for pictures."

399.title: 63 Indian cities are among 100 most polluted places on Earth: Report
399.article_body: As many as 63 out of the 100 most polluted cities in the world are Indian, as per the World air quality report 2021. Of these, more than half are in Haryana and Uttar Pradesh, while some are in Rajasthan, West Bengal, Punjab, MP and Bihar, the report said. Cities from neighbours Pakistan, China, Bangladesh also feature in the list.

400.title: Norwegian King Harald V tests positive for COVID-19: Royal palace
400.article_body: The royal palace of Norway on Tuesday said Norwegian King Harald V has tested positive for COVID-19. "The king has light symptoms and will be on sick leave in coming days," the palace added. The 85-year-old monarch has remained the ceremonial head of state since 1991 after he ascended the throne upon the death of his father, King Olav V.

401.title: 31-yr-old actor dating a woman online finds out he was talking to his father in US
401.article_body: Hollywood actor and filmmaker James Morosini revealed that he was catfished by his father posing as a woman on Facebook. The 31-year-old said he started dating a woman named Becca based on similar hobbies and interests. "I discovered it was my dad. He basically created this whole profile as a way of making sure that I was okay," Morosini said.

402.title: At least 1,100 earthquakes hit Portugal’s Azores islands in less than 48 hours
402.article_body: At least 1,100 small earthquakes were recorded in less than 48 hours in one of Portugal's mid-Atlantic volcanic islands. While the authorities urged residents to stay calm, an official at Azores archipelago's seismo-volcanic surveillance centre said the earthquakes have not caused any damage so far. The magnitude of the quakes ranged from 1.9 to 3.3 that struck Sao Jorge island.

403.title: 22-year-old Shanaya Kapoor buys Audi Q7 worth ₹80 lakh
403.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor and Maheep Kapoor's 22-year-old daughter Shanaya Kapoor has bought an Audi Q7 worth ₹80 lakh. Audi Mumbai West's Instagram handle shared a series of pictures of Shanaya posing with the car along with her parents. Earlier this month, filmmaker Karan Johar had announced her Bollywood debut with Dharma Productions' upcoming film 'Bedhadak'.

404.title: Uganda should end torture of detained citizens: Human Rights Watch
404.article_body: Human Rights Watch (HRW) on Tuesday said Ugandan government should end torture of citizens detained at detention centres. In its 62-page extensive report, HRW said the detainees, mainly government critics and opposition supporters were beaten, raped, electrocuted or injected with unknown substances. Report documented forced disappearances, arbitrary arrests and unlawful detention from 2018-2021.
